image.altText: Police officers in uniform patrolling a street.

props.synopsis: Just 57 Tasmanian children are responsible for half of all youth crime in the state, data shows, with a senior police officer saying the "therapeutic" approach won't work for some kids.

title.children: 57 kids 'responsible' for half of youth crime across Tasmania, data shows

image.altText: Indoor salmon farming facility with a series of tanks.

props.synopsis: In Canada, the government has committed to transition marine salmon farming near British Columbia to onshore operations by 2029. Tasmanian Greens want the state government to follow suit, but the salmon industry says it's a case of "voodoo economics".

title.children: Canada is banning ocean-based salmon farming. Could Tasmania do it?

image.altText: Woman holding plastic bottle near donation site

props.synopsis: Day one of Tasmania's long-awaited container refund scheme has kicked off. Eligible cans or bottles can now be deposited at one of 40 collection sites across the state for a refund price of 10 cents per container. And so far, the uptake has been "remarkable".

title.children: Tasmania's container refund scheme has started. What you need to know

props.synopsis: When it comes to potatoes, Tasmania punches above its weight, producing more than any other state. But do you know your Kennebec from your Dutch cream, or many of the other varieties in between?

title.children: In search of the best potato at Agfest

image.altText: A graphic with 15 faces with the words 'Your Say'

props.synopsis: Some Tasmanians are considering voting for non-major party candidates for the first time at Saturday's federal election, saying they are increasingly dissatisfied with the policies of Labor and the Liberals.Â

title.children: Too 'negative' and wrong priorities: Labor, Liberals on the nose with these voters

image.altText: Aerial view of southern right whale cow-calf pairs.

props.synopsis: The southern right whale species had the unfortunate habit of going close to shore, making them easy pickings for whalers. After the practice was banned, their population bounced back â but researchers say something disturbing is happening to their numbers.

title.children: Something is happening with the southern right whale population, scientists say

image.altText: A render of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, showing a wood-panelled round structure

props.synopsis: It's been debated for years but the fate of the proposed Macquarie Point stadium will soon be decided. Airlie Ward discusses the next crucial steps with reporter Josh Duggan.

title.children: TassieCast: It's crunch time for the proposed AFL stadium

image.altText: Peter Dutton drinks juice at a factory wearing hi vis

title.children: Props front and centre as leaders make final pitches on campaign trail

image.altText: Mike Waltz wears a checked shirt and cold-weather jacket.

props.synopsis: The Trump adviser responsible for the Signal group chat that became a national security scandal is being replaced and nominated as the next US ambassador at the United Nations.

title.children: Trump ousts 'Signalgate' national security adviser Mike Waltz

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson's estranged husband Simon Patterson appears for the second day as a witness in her trial. Follow the hearing in our live blog.

image.altText: two male politicians wearing suits at a park

image.altText: A mural dedicated to the Australian women killed by domestic violence in 2024 and 2025

image.altText: Albanese stands in the middle of a group of children, he's looking to the side with palms pressed together in greeting

image.altText: Unidentified woman in forground with left hand holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan

props.synopsis: A child born to an overseas commercial surrogate is in legal limbo, with experts estimating hundreds of other Australian children are also living with uncertain parentage.

title.children: Children left in legal limbo amid Australia's complex surrogacy laws

image.altText: An Amazon package sits on a doorstep.

props.synopsis: US stocks continue to reclaim ground from their post-tariff losses, with the S&P 500 gaining for an eighth straight session to reach its highest level since April 2. Amazon's shares fell in extended trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Amazon disappoints Wall St amid tariff uncertainty

image.altText: A pile of study materials, with a woman working on a computer visible in the background.

image.altText: A woman with short, light hair, smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council is auctioning two dozen properties to recover unpaid rates. But local Gina Greentree says the council has bungled the process, with the farmer bidding for a lot she thought she owned.Â

title.children: Property of man dead for 65 years among lots auctioned for unpaid rates

props.synopsis: Graziers are watching pastures disappear, despite some spending tens of thousands to protect their paddocks from voracious swarms threatening to grow to plague proportions.

title.children: After the rains, locusts descend on western Queensland properties

image.altText: a faceless couple holding hands stand looking at camera

props.synopsis: Perimenopause symptoms like mood swings, low libido and hot flushes can make life difficult for those who experience them. For partners, it can be confusing too. But there are ways to help.

title.children: How to support your partner through the 'hormonal chaos' of perimenopause
